docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Triggered after a character creation attempt, conveying the result.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• result: The result of the character creation attempt (True for success, False for failure).
  • reason: Reason for failure, if applicable.
  • error_text: Additional error text providing more context on the failure.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
def on_character_creation_result(event, result, reason, error_text):
    if result:
        print("Character created successfully.")
    else:
        print(f"Character creation failed: {reason} - {error_text}")

KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.CharacterCreationResult, on_character_creation_result)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Fired when a character name suggestion is made.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: • suggestion: The suggested name.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
def on_character_name_suggestion(event, suggestion):
    print(f"Suggested character name: {suggestion}")

KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.CharacterNameSuggestion, on_character_name_suggestion)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This event occurs when an attempt to suggest a character name fails, typically sent with no parameters.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
def on_character_name_suggestion_failed(event):
    print("Character name suggestion failed.")

KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.CharacterNameSuggestionFailed, on_character_name_suggestion_failed)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This event is triggered when the client crashes.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: • message: A descriptive message about the cause of the crash.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
def on_client_crashed(message):
    print(f"Client crashed due to: {message}")

KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.ClientCrashed, on_client_crashed)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This event is triggered when the client restarts, typically due to a follow transition failure.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: • reason: The reason for the client's restart.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
def on_client_restart(reason):
    print(f"Client restart due to: {reason}")

KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.ClientRestart, on_client_restart)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Triggered when the client shuts down, usually because of an error while attempting to auto-revive a player.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: • error: A description of the error that caused the shutdown.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
def on_client_shutdown(event, error):
    print(f"Client shutdown due to: {error}")

KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.ClientShutdown, on_client_shutdown)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This event is triggered when a character selection process is completed successfully. It signifies that the player has chosen a character with which to play, and the game client can proceed with loading the character's game session. This event is essential for initializing the game state for the selected character and preparing any necessary game environments or data specific to them.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• characterBaseInformations: An object containing base information about the character that has been successfully selected. The object includes:

  • sex: A boolean indicating the character's sex.

  • entityLook: An EntityLook object describing the character's appearance.
  • breed: An integer representing the character's breed.
  • level: An integer indicating the character's level.
  • name: A string containing the character's name.
  • id: An integer that serves as the unique identifier for the character.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
def on_character_selected_successfully(event, cbi):
    print(f"Character selected: {cbi.name} (ID: {cbi.id})")
    # Further logic to initialize the character's game session

KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.CharacterSelectionSuccess, on_character_selected_successfully)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This event is fired when the player successfully logs in to the game server. It signifies that the player's login attempt was successful and that the game session can now begin. This event is crucial for initiating any post-login processes, such as loading player data or transitioning to the game interface.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: • IdentificationSuccessMessage: The message received from the server upon successful identification. This message typically contains critical information regarding the player's account, such as privileges, subscription details, and other account-specific data.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
def on_player_login_success(event, ismsg):
    print(f"Login successful for account: {ismsg.login}")
    # Additional logic to handle successful login, such as fetching player data

KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.PlayerLoginSuccess, on_player_login_success)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This event is sent when a relogin token is generated, often as part of a reauthentication process.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• validToken: Indicates whether the token is valid.
  • token: The relogin token.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
def on_relogin_token(event, validToken, token):
    if validToken:
        print(f"Received valid relogin token: {token}")
    else:
        print("Received invalid relogin token.")

KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.ReloginToken, on_relogin_token)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This event is triggered when an object in the exchange is modified.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• iwModified: The modified item wrapper.
  • remote: Indicates if the modification was made by the remote party.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
def on_exchange_object_modified(event, iwModified, remote):
    if remote:
        print(f"Remote party modified item: {iwModified}")
    else:
        print(f"Local modification detected: {iwModified}")

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This event is triggered when the player started a fight.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
def onFight(event):
    # code to handle the player in fight
    pass

KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.FightStarted, onFight)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This event is triggered when an object is added to the inventory.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: • iw: A wrapper of the object added to the inventory.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
def onObjectAdded(event, iw):
    averageKamasWon = (
        Kernel().averagePricesFrame.getItemAveragePrice(iw.objectGID) * iw.quantity
    )
    Logger().debug(f"Average kamas won from item: {averageKamasWon}")

KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.ObjectAdded, onObjectAdded)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This event is triggered when an object is obtained.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• iw: A wrapper of the object added to the inventory.
  • qty: The quantity of the object obtained.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
def onObtainedItem(event, iw, qty):
    averageKamasWon = (
        Kernel().averagePricesFrame.getItemAveragePrice(iw.objectGID) * qty
    )
    Logger().debug(f"Average kamas won from item: {averageKamasWon}")

KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.ObtainedItem, onObtainedItem)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This event is fired in the JobsFrame when a job gains experience.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• oldJobXp: The previous job experience value.
  • jobExp: An instance of JobExperience containing the job ID and the gained experience details.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.JobExperienceUpdate, self.onJobExperience)
def onJobExperience(self, event, oldJobXp, jobExp):
    Logger().info(f"Job {jobExp.jobId} has gained {jobExp.jobXP} xp")

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This event is fired in the JobsFrame when a job levels up.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• jobId: The job ID that leveled up.
  • jobName: The name of the job that leveled up.
  • lastLevel: The previous level of the job.
  • newLevel: The new level of the job.
  • podsBonus: The pods bonus gained from leveling up.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.JobLevelUp, self.onJobLevelUp)

def onJobLevelUp(self, event, jobId, jobName, lastLevel, newLevel, podsBonus):
    Logger().info(f"Job {jobName} has leveled up from level {lastLevel} to {newLevel}")
    Logger().info(f"Pods bonus gained: {podsBonus}")

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Fired when there's an update to a character's alignment rank.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: • alignmentRank: The new alignment rank.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
def on_alignment_rank_update(event, alignmentRank):
    print(f"Alignment rank updated to: {alignmentRank}")

KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.AlignmentRankUpdate, on_alignment_rank_update)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Indicates an update to the war effort, typically with no parameters sent.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
def on_update_war_effort(event):
    print("War effort has been updated.")

KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.UpdateWarEffortHook, on_update_war_effort)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This event is triggered when the player started a fight.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: • kamas: The new amount of kamas.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
def onKamasUpdate(event, kamas):
    pass

KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.KamasUpdate, onKamasUpdate)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This event is fired when a player levels up.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• oldLevel: The previous player level.
  • newLevel: The new player level.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
def onPlayerLevelUp(event, oldLevel, newLevel):
    Logger().info(f"Player has leveled up from {oldLevel} to {newLevel}")

KernelEventsManager().on(KernelEvent.PlayerLevelUp, onPlayerLevelUp)

docs.title: KernelEventsManager Class Documentation
docs.text:
KernelEventsManager is a singleton class that manages events throughout the application, built on top of the EventsHandler base class.

Initializes the KernelEventsManager instance.

docs.title: onceFramePushed
docs.text:
Registers a callback to be executed once when a specific frame is pushed.

def onceFramePushed(self, frameName, callback, args=[], originator=None):
    # Method implementation

docs.title: onceFramePulled
docs.text:
Registers a callback to be executed once when a specific frame is pulled.

def onceFramePulled(self, frameName, callback, args=[], originator=None):
    # Method implementation

docs.title: onceMapProcessed
docs.text:
Registers a callback to be executed once when a map has been processed.

def onceMapProcessed(self, callback, args=[], mapId=None, timeout=None, ontimeout=None, originator=None):
    # Method implementation

docs.title: send
docs.text:
Sends an event to all registered listeners for the given event ID.

def send(self, event_id: KernelEvent, *args, **kwargs):
    # Method implementation

docs.title: onceActorShowed
docs.text:
Registers a callback for when an actor is shown, executed only once.

def onceActorShowed(self, actorId, callback, args=[], originator=None):
    # Method implementation

docs.title: onEntityMoved
docs.text:
Registers a callback for when an entity moves.

def onEntityMoved(self, entityId, callback, timeout=None, ontimeout=None, once=False, originator=None):
    # Method implementation

docs.title: onceEntityMoved
docs.text:
Registers a callback for when an entity moves, executed only once.

def onceEntityMoved(self, entityId, callback, timeout=None, ontimeout=None, originator=None):
    # Method implementation

docs.title: onceEntityVanished
docs.text:
Registers a callback for when an entity vanishes.

def onceEntityVanished(self, entityId, callback, args=[], originator=None):
    # Method implementation

... (and so on) ...
